item.title: Report E-2024010161
item.description:
Report E-2024010161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 4, 2024, six (6) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were forked and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the released product in the trailer and outside of the trailer and collected them with hand tools. HCE personnel then utilized universal absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted pallets and surfaces. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the six (6) damaged pails, and one (1) 55-gallon drum that contained impacted absorbents and debris were both labeled appropriately and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2024010111
item.description:
Report E-2024010111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: AURORA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAU experienced a UN2874 Enviroset 40E FNB Resin release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 5’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a faulty leaking seal on the 55-gallon metal drum. The drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010185
item.description:
Report X-2024010185

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Metal pail found leaking from handle. Pail was placed into a haz bag and tote. Tote was brought to a QA area. DescribePack: The area where the handle connects to the pail was dented. The dent caused the metal piece to partially detach from pail causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Metal pail was placed into a haz bag and tote. Tote was brought to a QA area.

item.title: Report E-2024010227
item.description:
Report E-2024010227

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a thirty-gallon spill of regulated UN1169 "Orange Oil Brazil" that was released at Terminal XLA. (1) a 55-gallon metal drum was punctured by a forklift during dock operations. Terminal personnel felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 85-gallon metal drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged drum, the remaining product, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010220
item.description:
Report E-2024010220

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-qts of NON-CHLORINATED BRAKE CLEANER (UN1206) were released from one 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by the shipper, PLZ Corp. The release impacted trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 10 gallon DM containing one 5-gallon metal pial of NON-CHLORINATED BRAKE CLEANER and oil dri was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010222
item.description:
Report E-2024010222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Chicago Heights, IL. The spill consisted of (1) 5 gallon plastic pail of Universal Blending Reducer (UN1263), which was punctured by a forklift blade during unloading, causing all 5 gallons to release .The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they will clean up the spill with Oil Dri and place the contents into a 35-gallon metal drum for disposal. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010357
item.description:
Report X-2024010357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and leaking near bank 3. Package had Fully Regulated Corrosive HazMat labeling. The 4 individual bottles were all scattered on the floor, 1 of which was leaking. 3 of the 4 bottles had dents from some sort of impact. Package was immediately taken off the warehouse floor and isolated from the rest of the employees. DescribePack: 3 of the 4 bottles had dents, 1 of which began leaking out of its cap. Package leaked red liquid all over the floor. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat cage for isolation and processing.
